Method Detail

isNotEmpty

public void isNotEmpty()
Ensures that the given array is not null and contains at least one element. Additionally, ensures that each element of the array is not null.

Throws:
AssertionFailedException - if the array is empty (or null), or at least one array element is null.

isNotEmpty

public void isNotEmpty(java.lang.String explanation,
                       java.lang.Object... args)
Ensures that the given array is not null and contains at least one element. Additionally, ensures that each element of the array is not null.

Parameters:
explanation - a formatted message explaining the assertion
args - Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the formatted explanation. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of arguments is variable and may be zero.
Throws:
AssertionFailedException - if the array is empty (or null), or at least one array element is null.
